topic.title: Using Firmware Disaster Recovery Mode

section.p: The Switchtec devices are designed with disaster recovery hardware pin on the device (BOOT_RECOVERYB[1]). The pin is active low. For detail description of the pins, please refer to Pin Setting
The disaster recovery mode is implemented in BL2, and there are a redundant partition for BL2, which means disaster recovery mode can work even one of BL2 is corrupted.
The disaster recovery menus are intended to provide multiple options to bring the switch back online:

li.p: Configuration or main firmware image is corrupted, bootloaders are alive
The primary menu will provide options to select alternate images to boot from (see Figure 1)
All configuration and main firmware image are corrupted, BL1 and BL2 are alive
The primary menu will provide options to select alternate images to boot from (see Figure 2)
All configuration and/or main firmware images are corrupted and the BL1/BL2 are also corrupted
In this case there is no mechanism for the device to load firmware without the assistance of a MULTI debugger or a removal of the SPI flash and offline programming
Actually this case is highly unlikely to happen because Compatibility Check and Rollback mechanism is introduced, which can avoid this case to happen.
There is a hidden option "7" in image load menu to download a raw flash image.
In this case, a new flash image must be loaded onto the switch. This can be done using an XMODEM transfer which is accessible via a secondary window (see Figure 1)

section.title: Boot loader recovery menu
section.p: The boot loader recovery menu is accessible by holding the BOOT_RECOVERYB pin low while the switch is powering on. In this scenario, the menu illustrated in Figure 1 is displayed.
The options in the menu are described in more detail in Table 1.

row.entry: Load the current FW and Config images (as if the switch were booting normally)
Load the current FW image but load the secondary configuration image (this is a good option if a recent config file change caused the switch to not boot)
Load the backup FW image but the current configuration image (this is a good option for cases where a prior FW image upgrade may have failed)
Load the backup FW and backup configuration image (in case the previous upgrades to both FW and Config resulted in error)

section.title: Image load menu
section.p: The image load menu is available as a secondary menu when selecting boot recovery options. The boot recovery menu must be access first before this menu is available. After the boot recovery menu is loaded, it is not important which boot option is selected. Simply select one boot option and then press CTRL-B to access the secondary menu which is illustrated in Figure 2.
The options in the menu are described in more detail in #section_Disaster_Recovery_0iarc7iop/Table_Description_Of_Boot_Configuration_Menu.

row.entry: Update Image Through Xmodem WITHOUT activate
Loads a .pmc file through XMODEM to the switch and the new image is not activated
Saves a .pmc file from the switch over XMODEM to the debug computer
Saves a raw SPI Flash image (the type that goes into a SPI programmer) containing all images together (boot loader, partition map, flash image, configuration) to the debug computer
Displays the current partition information of the SPI flash including versions of images in the active and inactive partitions
Exits the menu and performs a hard reset to the switch
Toggle images after updating new images
Loads a raw SPI Flash image (the type that goes into a SPI programmer) containing all images together (boot loader, partition map, flash image, configuration)

section.title: Toggle Menu
section.p: The Toggle Menu is to activate new images after updating new images. Because of the Compatibility check, new Main FW image and CFG image must be activated at the same time.

The options in the menu are described in more detail in #section_Disaster_Recovery_0iarc7iop/Table_Description_Of_Toggle_Menu #section_Disaster_Recovery_0iarc7iop/Table_Description_Of_Boot_Configuration_Menu.

row.entry: Activate new BL2 after updating BL2
Activate new CFG after updating CFG
Activate new Main FW after updating Main FW
Activate new CFG and Main FW if both CFG and Main FW are updated

section.title: Steps to boot from an alternate flash partition
section.p: The following steps describe how to recover from a corrupted firmware configuration or flash image:

li.p: Set BOOT_RECOVERY[1] to low and power on the switch
The menu illustrated in Figure 1 will be displayed
Select the alternate boot option (1,2,3,4) to boot
The device will boot the selected option

section.title: Steps to load a new firmware image or configuration file to the flash using ChipLink
section.p: The following steps describe how to load a new .pmc configuration file to the switch using ChipLink and disaster recovery

li.p: Set BOOT_RECOVERY[1] to low and power on the switch
The following menu as illustrated in Figure 1 will be displayed
When prompted hold CTRL-B to bring up the secondary image load menu illustrated in Figure 2
Open ChipLink and select New Connection
Under Connection Type select Disaster Recovery Terminal
li.draft-comment: the chiplink is not ready for Trident, the screenshot of chiplink is from Saratoga and should be updated when chiplink is ready

li.p: Open the Firmware Download Tool and select Read Partitions

fig.title: ChipLink Disaster Recovery Terminal Firmware Download Tool

li.p: Select Choose Image and download the firmware
Select '5' for Exit and Reset which will load the new image

section.title: Steps to load a new firmware image, configuration file image to the flash over Xmodem
section.p: The following steps describe how to load a new .pmc configuration file to the switch using Xmodem and disaster recovery

li.p: Set BOOT_RECOVERY[1] to low and power on the switch
The following menu as illustrated in Figure 1 will be displayed
When prompted hold CTRL-B to bring up the secondary image load menu illustrated in Figure 2
Select '1' for Update Image through Xmodem
The switch will now enter Xmodem receiver mode
In a compliant Xmodem program such as TeraTerm, select XMODEM Transfer and then select the .pmc image to load
The transfer will complete and the secondary image load menu will be displayed again
Go to step 4 to continue update images if more images are needed to be updated.
Activate new images by choosing "5".
Select '6' for Exit and Reset which will load the new image loaded

section.title: Steps to burn entire factory image to the flash over Xmodem
section.p: The following steps describe how to burn the factory image to the switch using Xmodem and disaster recovery

li.p: Generate the factory image using pmc-flash-img-gen.sh script
Set BOOT_RECOVERY[1:0] to 00b/01b/10b and power on the switch
The following menu as illustrated in Figure 1 will be displayed
When prompted hold CTRL-B to bring up the secondary image load menu illustrated in Figure 2
Select '6' for Update Factory Image through Xmodem
The switch will now enter Xmodem receiver mode
In a compliant Xmodem program such as TeraTerm, select XMODEM Transfer and then select the factory image to burn
The transfer will complete and the secondary image load menu will be displayed again
Select '5' for Exit and Reset which will load the new image loaded or have a power cycle to reboot.
